info.name: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Spells

element.name: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic
Diagnose
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You know the names of any diseases, curses or poisons that are affecting the creature you touch.

element.name: Magic Tool
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: Touch a non-magical tool. It becomes magical with a +1 to ability check rolls until the spell ends.

element.name: Nightlight
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You light a candle which casts a pale blue light that only you can see. The candle casts bright light in a 5’ radius and dim light for an additional 5’. This light is invisible to creatures without truesight.
Besides being invisible, the flame is otherwise normal. The candle burns at a normal rate and gives off heat. Other fires set from this candle are not magical and are visible.

setters.set: A non-magical candle worth at least 1 cp which is consumed by the spell

element.name: Pedigree
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: As you cast the spell, you offer a small piece of parchment to a willing creature. If they touch it, the following information magically appears written on it:
If the creature doesn’t know the information themselves or if they don’t possess one of the fields, “N/A” appears in lieu of the information.

element.name: Piggy Bank
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You cause a tiny ceramic animal to magically be able to hold many more coins than normal. For the duration, the container is able to hold up to 1000 coins that are deposited into its coin slot. The container weighs less than a pound, regardless of its contents.
As an action, a creature can flip the container over a tap the bottom which ejects a random coin from inside the container to be ejected from the coin slot.

When the spell ends, the stopper is magically ejected and all of the coins in the container spill out. Pulling the stopper out early ends the spell. Putting anything other than coins into the container or putting the container into any other extradimensional space ends the spell. Damaging the container ends the spell. You can’t have more than one Piggy Bank at a time. Casting this spell again ends the effect on the first container.

setters.set: a tiny ceramic animal with a coin slot and a stopper in the bottom

element.name: Portrait
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You create a small likeness of a creature that you are familiar with that resembles a black and white painting. If you cast this spell while consuming 10 GP of paints, the likeness is a high quality color painting instead.
The likeness is blank if the chosen creature is a Vampire.

setters.set: a canvas to display the likeness

element.name: Quill
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You cause a stylus or quill to become a magical multipurpose tool. While the spell lasts: You can write in any color at will, regardless of the kind of ink it is dipped in. You can command the quill to transcribe the speech of any creature within 30 feet as long as you understand the language. You can command the quill to copy the contents of any non-magical open book, scroll or sheaf of parchment within 5’ of it onto an empty book, scroll or sheaf of parchment papers. The quill copies quickly at the rate of 1 page per minute and requires a normal amount of ink. Spellbooks and Spell Scrolls are magical and cannot be copied.

element.name: Rin’s Comfy Aura
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You cause a bubble of air around yourself to become comfortable and dry. While you maintain concentration, non-magical weather cannot cause you to become wet nor suffer from exposure. You always succeed on Constitution saving throws related to non-magical weather. You cannot gain points of Exhaustion from non-magical weather.

element.name: Thermos
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You cause a container you touch to magically maintain temperature for the duration. Choose a non-magical container of up to 1 cubic foot. While closed, objects inside the container won’t return to room temperature. The container itself remains room temperature and isn’t damaged by heated or chilled objects inside of it. If the container is damaged, the effect ends. You can’t have more than one Thermos at a time. Casting this spell again ends the effect on the first container.

element.name: Appraisal
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You choose one object or creature within 30 feet of you that you can see. If it’s an object, you learn its fair market price, notwithstanding bargaining power or regional scarcity. If it’s a creature, you learn its total class levels or its Challenge Rating if it has any.

element.name: Compactor
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You cause a container you touch to become able to crush objects into a small space. Choose a non-magical container of up to 6 cubic feet (a standard barrel is 5 and a half cubic feet). While closed it exerts tremendous crushing force on any objects placed inside. The container isn’t damaged by objects put inside of it. After 1 minute of crushing, all objects in the closed container are packed into a dense cube. The total weight remains the same but the cube’s volume is 1/8th the volume of all the objects put inside (one size category smaller). Liquids and magical items are unaffected by the crushing and stay at the bottom of the bag rather than being packed into the cube.

If an animate creature is put into the container or if the container is damaged, the spell ends. You can’t have more than one Compactor at a time. Casting this spell again ends the effect on the first container.

element.name: Hot Box/Cold Box
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You cause a container you touch to magically change temperature for the duration. Choose a non-magical container of up to 3 cubic feet and choose a desired temperature between 500 to 0 Fahrenheit (260 to -18 Celsius). While closed, the interior of the container and all objects inside slowly become the desired temperature after 10 minutes. The container itself remains room temperature and isn’t damaged by the heated or chilled objects inside of it. If the container is damaged, the effect ends. You can’t have more than one Hot Box/Cold Box at a time. Casting this spell again ends the effect on the first container.

element.name: Instant Grooming
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: You make yourself and up to seven other companions in range as presentable as possible. All clothes and armor are magically cleaned, mended and pressed. Bodies are scoured of blood, sweat, dirt as if they had been scrubbed extensively in a shower. Hair is cleaned, cut, combed and styled as desired (how the caster desires -- not the hair’s owner).

setters.set: a sewing needle, a piece of soap and a comb

element.name: Lu’s Folding Mule
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: A friendly animal folds neatly into a box for safe keeping. When you cast this spell and touch a friendly Beast of CR less than or equal to 1, it folds up into a 1” cube which resembles a wooden box painted with the colors of the animal it contains. The box weighs 1 pounds, regardless of the animal it contains. When the spell ends, the animal emerges unharmed as if no time had passed. You may end the spell early by using an action to speak the name of the animal while holding the box. Damaging the box also ends the spell early.

element.name: Magical Manifest
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: Choose a 5’ cube of space next to you. An exact list of all objects and creatures contained in that space magically appears on the piece of parchment.

element.name: Phantom Workshop
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: This spell creates a temporary quasi-real workshop in a 10’x10’ area. Choose a type of artisan’s tools, a workshop containing those tools and its associated gear appears. For example, choosing Smith’s Tools would cause quasi-real hammers, tongs, pliers to appear along with an anvil, forge, fuel and bellows. A person who is proficient with the chosen tools can use this phantom workshop as effectively as a real workshop.

Any of the equipment or materials created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried outside the area or when the spell ends. Therefore, it’s necessary to provide real raw materials to create anything that lasts after the spell ends.

element.name: Quest Map
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: As you cast this spell, an unlabeled 10 x 10 mile map of your surroundings scribes itself onto the parchment. Geographical features such as forests, mountains, rivers, lakes, oceans, etc. as well as permanent settlements and roads are all visible. Finer details such as individual buildings aren’t visible. A small ‘X’ indicates the caster’s current location.
The spell fails if the caster is not on the Prime Material plane. It also fails if there are Gates, portals to other planes or any other non-Euclidean geometries within the 10 x 10 mile area.

element.name: Unseen Apprentice
element.source: Old Owlbear’s Tome of Practical Magic

description.p: This spell creates an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs complex tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 10, and it can’t attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. It has the same tool, vehicle, game and instrument proficiencies that you do and makes ability checks with the same modifiers as you.

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the apprentice to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The apprentice can perform complex tasks that a human apprentice with your proficiencies could do, such as pumping bellows, playing dragon chess, crafting weapons, picking locks, playing a song, cooking food, and mending armor. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command. The apprentice requires the raw materials to complete the task to be provided for it. The apprentice can use the Help action to assist you with ability checks that use your tool, vehicle, game or instrument proficiencies.
If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.
